title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: NEVER use Urban Institute API, NCES CCD, federal data source — entire point packages provide STATE-LEVEL data directly state . Federal sources aggregate/transform data differently lose state-specific details. state DOE source broken, FIX find alternative STATE source — fall back federal data.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: arschooldata package provides access Arkansas school data Arkansas Division Elementary Secondary Education (DESE). primary data source Annual Statistical Reports (ASR), contain district-level fiscal enrollment data. IMPORTANT: package provides Average Daily Attendance (ADA) data, enrollment demographics race/ethnicity. See Data Limitations section .

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: Annual Statistical Reports (ASR): https://dese.ade.arkansas.gov/offices/data-management/annual-statistical-report ADE Data Center (demographics): https://adedata.arkansas.gov/statewide/

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: Use get_available_years() check availability:
code: get_available_years() # Returns: min_year=2006, max_year=2024 #          available_years=c(2006, 2013:2024) #          gap_years=2007:2012

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: ASR files provide fiscal/budget data following key columns: Note: Column names vary across years due different ASR file formats.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: tidy=TRUE version MUST maintain fidelity raw, unprocessed source file. Every test verify actual values raw data appear correctly tidied output.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: District-level Average Daily Attendance (ADA) Fiscal/budget information (revenue, expenditure, mills, etc.) District identifiers names

what: What This Package Does NOT Provide (yet)
title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: Enrollment counts race/ethnicity (demographics) School-level data Grade-level breakdowns Demographics data available ADE Data Center requires ASP.NET session-based scraping yet implemented.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
code: # R package check (required) devtools::check()  # Python tests (required) system("pip install -e ./pyarschooldata && pytest tests/test_pyarschooldata.py -v")  # pkgdown build (required) pkgdown::build_site()

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: opening PR, verify: - [ ] devtools::check() — 0 errors, 0 warnings - [ ] pytest tests/test_pyarschooldata.py — tests pass - [ ] pkgdown::build_site() — builds without errors - [ ] Vignettes render (eval=FALSE hacks)

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: Run tests : Tests verify: - Data fidelity: Raw values match tidied output - Year coverage: available years can fetched - Data quality: impossible values (negative ADA, ADA > 50,000) - District existence: Major districts present years
code: devtools::test()

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: CRITICAL: tests must verify tidy=TRUE output maintains FIDELITY raw, unprocessed source data.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: One test per year: Every year package supports (2006, 2013-2024) least one test verifying specific ADA value raw Excel file. Raw data fidelity tests: Tests compare specific numeric values raw Excel files ensure package doesn’t corrupt misparse data. Data quality checks: Every test file includes checks : negative ADA values impossibly large ADA values (>30,000) Major districts non-zero ADA State total ADA plausible (~400,000-450,000) Cross-year consistency: District counts major district presence verified across years.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: See tests/testthat/test-raw-data-fidelity.R comprehensive fidelity testing pattern.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: package includes tests/testthat/test-pipeline-live.R LIVE network tests.

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: URL Availability - HTTP 200 checks File Download - Verify actual file (HTML error) File Parsing - readxl/readr succeeds Column Structure - Expected columns exist get_raw_enr() - Raw data function works Data Quality - Inf/NaN, non-negative counts Aggregation - State total > 0 Output Fidelity - tidy=TRUE matches raw

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: See state-schooldata/CLAUDE.md complete testing framework documentation.
code: devtools::test(filter = "pipeline-live")

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: NEVER push directly main. changes must go PRs auto-merge:
code: # 1. Create feature branch git checkout -b fix/description-of-change  # 2. Make changes, commit git add -A git commit -m "Fix: description of change"  # 3. Push and create PR with auto-merge git push -u origin fix/description-of-change gh pr create --title "Fix: description" --body "Description of changes" gh pr merge --auto --squash  # 4. Clean up stale branches after PR merges git checkout main && git pull && git fetch --prune origin

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: Clean stale branches every time touch package:
code: # Delete local branches merged to main git branch --merged main | grep -v main | xargs -r git branch -d  # Prune remote tracking branches git fetch --prune origin

title: Arkansas School Data Package (arschooldata)
text: PRs auto-merge CI checks pass: - R-CMD-check (0 errors, 0 warnings) - Python tests (py{st}schooldata exists) - pkgdown build (vignettes must render) CI fails, fix issue push - auto-merge triggers checks pass.

title: Data Source Errata
text: Arkansas package currently fetches data Annual Statistical Reports (ASR) contains primarily financial budget data, enrollment demographics (race/ethnicity breakdowns) package API designed provide.

title: Data Source Errata
text: fetch_enr() function return data frame : - is_state, is_district, is_school, is_charter - aggregation level flags - subgroup - demographic categories (total_enrollment, white, black, hispanic, etc.) - grade_level - grade breakdowns (K, 01, 02, … 12, TOTAL) - n_students - enrollment counts - pct - percentage total

title: Data Source Errata
text: ASR files contain: - ADA (Average Daily Attendance) - single count, broken demographics - Financial data (revenue, expenditure, mills, etc.) - District identifiers

title: Data Source Errata
text: ASR Excel files Arkansas Division Elementary Secondary Education contain fiscal/budget data, enrollment demographics. enrollment demographics available ADE Data Center (adedata.arkansas.gov), uses ASP.NET postback forms require session-based scraping.

title: Data Source Errata
text: proper ADE Data Center integration implemented, package provides limited functionality: - ADA counts available rough proxy enrollment - Full demographic breakdowns require manual download ADE Data Center

title: Data Source Errata
text: Implement session-based scraping ADE Data Center enrollment reports Add proper process_enrollment.R standardize raw data Add proper tidy_enrollment.R transform long format demographics

title: Data Source Errata
text: manually downloading enrollment demographics, visit: https://adedata.arkansas.gov/statewide/ReportList/State/EnrollmentByRace.aspx

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: arschooldata package provides access Arkansas school data Arkansas Division Elementary Secondary Education (DESE). vignette demonstrates use package fetch analyze Arkansas school enrollment data.

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("almartin82/arschooldata")

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: fetching data, check years available: Important: Years 2007-2012 currently available due missing data URLs.
code: years <- get_available_years() print(years$description) #> [1] "Arkansas enrollment data is available from 2005-06 (end_year 2006) and 2012-13 (end_year 2013) through 2023-24 (end_year 2024). NOTE: Years 2007-2012 are NOT currently available due to missing ASR URLs. Data comes from the Annual Statistical Reports published by the Arkansas Division of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE). The data contains fiscal/budget information including Average Daily Attendance (ADA), but NOT enrollment demographics by race/ethnicity." cat("\nAvailable years:", paste(years$available_years, collapse = ", ")) #>  #> Available years: 2006, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024 cat("\nGap years (not available):", paste(years$gap_years, collapse = ", ")) #>  #> Gap years (not available): 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: Use fetch_enr() download enrollment data single year:
code: # Fetch 2024 data (2023-24 school year) data_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # View dimensions dim(data_2024)  # View column names names(data_2024)[1:15]

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: returned data contains district-level fiscal information Arkansas Annual Statistical Reports. Key columns include: District identifiers: District name 7-digit LEA code ADA: Average Daily Attendance (closest proxy enrollment) ADM: Average Daily Membership Fiscal data: Revenue, expenditure, property tax, mill rates Note: Column names vary year due different Excel file formats. Use patterns find right columns: Helper function finding columns:
code: # District name column name_col <- if ("1" %in% names(data)) "1"             else if ("district_name" %in% names(data)) "district_name"             else "actual_amount"  # 2013 format  # District ID column id_col <- if ("2" %in% names(data)) "2" else "district_lea"  # ADA column ada_col <- if ("2_ada" %in% names(data)) "2_ada" else "ada"

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: Use fetch_enr_multi() download data multiple years :
code: # Fetch 5 years of data data_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # Check years included table(data_multi$end_year)

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: Header rows data: years include 1-3 header rows filtered (identifiable non-numeric district IDs) Educational cooperatives: Arkansas Educational Service Cooperatives appear data zero ADA (correct - don’t directly serve students) District consolidations: districts show zero ADA transition years due consolidation closure Divide--zero values: 3_ada_pct_change_over_5_years column contains /0 new districts without 5-year history

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: Always filter valid data rows analysis:
code: # Get valid district rows (exclude headers and cooperatives if needed) id_col <- if ("2" %in% names(data)) "2" else "district_lea"  valid_districts <- data |>   filter(     !is.na(.data[[id_col]]),     grepl("^[0-9]+$", .data[[id_col]])   )  # Optionally exclude cooperatives (zero ADA entities) ada_col <- if ("2_ada" %in% names(data)) "2_ada" else "ada" active_districts <- valid_districts |>   filter(as.numeric(.data[[ada_col]]) > 0)

what: Example Analysis: Top Districts by ADA
title: Getting Started with arschooldata
code: library(ggplot2)  # Get 2024 data data_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Filter to valid data rows and convert ADA to numeric clean_data <- data_2024 |>   filter(!is.na(`2`), grepl("^[0-9]", `2`)) |>   mutate(     district_name = `1`,     ada = as.numeric(`2_ada`)   )  # Top 10 districts by ADA top_10 <- clean_data |>   arrange(desc(ada)) |>   head(10)  print(top_10[, c("district_name", "ada")])  # Expected output (2023-24 data): # Springdale: ~20,313 # Bentonville: ~17,929 # Little Rock: ~17,582 # Rogers: ~14,333 # Fort Smith: ~12,404 # Plot top 10 districts ggplot(top_10, aes(x = reorder(district_name, ada), y = ada)) +   geom_col(fill = "steelblue") +   coord_flip() +   labs(     title = "Top 10 Arkansas School Districts by ADA (2023-24)",     x = NULL,     y = "Average Daily Attendance"   ) +   theme_minimal()

what: Example Analysis: ADA Trends Over Time
title: Getting Started with arschooldata
code: # Get multi-year data data_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(c(2006, 2013:2024))  # Calculate state totals by year # Note: Must handle different column names across years calculate_state_ada <- function(data) {   id_col <- if ("2" %in% names(data)) "2" else "district_lea"   ada_col <- if ("2_ada" %in% names(data)) "2_ada" else "ada"    valid <- data[!is.na(data[[id_col]]) & grepl("^[0-9]+$", data[[id_col]]), ]   sum(as.numeric(valid[[ada_col]]), na.rm = TRUE) }  state_totals <- data_multi |>   group_by(end_year) |>   summarize(     total_ada = sum(as.numeric(`2_ada`), na.rm = TRUE)   )  # Plot state total ADA over time ggplot(state_totals, aes(x = end_year, y = total_ada)) +   geom_line(color = "steelblue", linewidth = 1) +   geom_point(color = "steelblue", size = 3) +   scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::comma) +   labs(     title = "Arkansas Total K-12 Average Daily Attendance",     x = "School Year (End Year)",     y = "Total ADA"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Getting Started with arschooldata
text: default, downloaded data cached locally avoid repeated downloads: Cache management:
code: # Check cache status cache_status() # Clear all cached data clear_cache()  # Clear only 2024 data clear_cache(2024)  # Force fresh download data_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)

title: Arkansas School Enrollment: An Overview
text: package provides access Arkansas school enrollment data Arkansas Department Education. Use get_available_years() see available date range:
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2006 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2024 #>  #> $available_years #>  [1] 2006 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 #>  #> $gap_years #> [1] 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Arkansas enrollment data is available from 2005-06 (end_year 2006) and 2012-13 (end_year 2013) through 2023-24 (end_year 2024). NOTE: Years 2007-2012 are NOT currently available due to missing ASR URLs. Data comes from the Annual Statistical Reports published by the Arkansas Division of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE). The data contains fiscal/budget information including Average Daily Attendance (ADA), but NOT enrollment demographics by race/ethnicity."

what: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: See full analysis charts data output: 10 Insights Arkansas Enrollment Data 21 years enrollment data (2005-2025). 470,000 students across 235+ districts Natural State. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
what: 1. Arkansas enrollment peaked and is declining
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas public school enrollment peaked around 2020 nearly 480,000 students declining since, following national trends.
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, Fayetteville among fastest-growing school districts state, fueled Walmart, Tyson, tech corridor.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Bentonville|Rogers|Springdale|Fayetteville", district_name)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   summarize(     y2015 = n_students[end_year == 2015],     y2025 = n_students[end_year == 2025],     pct_change = round((y2025 / y2015 - 1) * 100, 1)   ) %>%   arrange(desc(pct_change))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Kindergarten enrollment dropped sharply pandemic parents delayed enrollment, creating smaller cohort now moving elementary schools.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "05", "09")) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
what: 4. Little Rock is no longer the largest district
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Springdale Public Schools surpassed Little Rock School District become state’s largest, reflecting growth Northwest Arkansas.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Hispanic students gone 10% 15% Arkansas enrollment, concentrated poultry-processing regions Northwest Arkansas.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2005:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "hispanic", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas Delta counties seen sharpest enrollment declines agricultural mechanization reduces jobs families move cities.
code: # Phillips, Lee, Chicot, Mississippi counties enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Phillips|Lee County|Chicot|Blytheville", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   filter(n() > 5) %>%   summarize(     earliest = n_students[end_year == min(end_year)],     latest = n_students[end_year == max(end_year)],     pct_change = round((latest / earliest - 1) * 100, 1)   ) %>%   arrange(pct_change)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: state’s demographics shifting, white students still comprise nearly two-thirds enrollment, Black students concentrated Central Delta regions.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial")) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas charter schools growing, particularly Little Rock area district turmoil pushed families alternatives.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_charter, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: 60% Arkansas students qualify economically disadvantaged, one highest rates nation.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("econ_disadv", "total_enrollment")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Small rural districts consolidated absorbed, dozens districts fewer 500 students.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   filter(n_students < 500) %>%   arrange(n_students) %>%   head(15) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)

title: Arkansas School Data

title: Arkansas School Data
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Arkansas School Data
code: import pyarschooldata as ar  # Check available years years = ar.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year df = ar.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years df_multi = ar.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # State totals state_total = df[(df['is_state'] == True) &                  (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                  (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]  # District breakdown districts = df[(df['is_district'] == True) &                (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)

what: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years

text: Returns range school years enrollment data available Arkansas Department Education.

title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years()

title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
text: list following elements: min_year earliest available school year end (e.g., 2006 2005-06) max_year latest available school year end (e.g., 2024 2023-24) available_years Integer vector years data URLs gap_years Integer vector years without data URLs (2007-2012) description Human-readable description data availability

title: Get available years for Arkansas enrollment data — get_available_years
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2006 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2024 #>  #> $available_years #>  [1] 2006 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 2019 2020 2021 2022 2023 2024 #>  #> $gap_years #> [1] 2007 2008 2009 2010 2011 2012 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Arkansas enrollment data is available from 2005-06 (end_year 2006) and 2012-13 (end_year 2013) through 2023-24 (end_year 2024). NOTE: Years 2007-2012 are NOT currently available due to missing ASR URLs. Data comes from the Annual Statistical Reports published by the Arkansas Division of Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE). The data contains fiscal/budget information including Average Daily Attendance (ADA), but NOT enrollment demographics by race/ethnicity." #>  # Returns list with available years and description
